meanings.sent1: My cobber and I always have each other's backs.
meanings.sent2: I met my cobber in school, and we've been friends ever since.
meanings.sent3: When my cobber and I get together, it's always a good time.
meanings.sent4: He's not just a friend; he's a cobber who sticks with me through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: Having a loyal cobber makes life more enjoyable and meaningful.

meanings.definition: To be friendly or sociable with someone.
meanings.sent1: I always try to cobber with new people I meet.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys cobbering with her colleagues during lunch breaks.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to cobber with the dog, which was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His ability to cobber with strangers is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: Cobbering with others can lead to new and exciting experiences.
